missions.name: Recognising Ownship & third party tracks
missions.description: Very gentle steps in reading and interacting with the sonar.
missions.situation: We've got a towed array training module configured for you, preset in auto-resolve mode (so you won't be seeing ambiguous bearings). You're in a scenario with a merchant, a dived submarine, and a jet-ski. Since this is your very first mission, we'll start off with you gently. Be sure to read the instructions in the message box towards the bottom of the screen.

children.name: Select ownship track
children.description: Select the ownship noise trace in the sonar display.

children.name: Identify surface vessel track
children.description: Select the noise trace for the vessel to the South West of you.

children.name: Identify dived submarine track
children.description: Select the noise trace for the dived track

children.name: Identify jet ski
children.description: We've instructed the jet ski to conduct a fast pass. Select it on the sonar when it accelerates

missions.name: Understanding bearing ambiguity in surface contacts
missions.description: Using easy surface contacts to highlight bearing ambiguity
missions.situation: The training array now shows ambiguous bearings, you're going to be learning which is the true bearing to each target

children.name: Select ownship track
children.description: Select the ownship noise trace in the sonar display

children.name: Identify NW target track
children.description: Select any bearing that represents the target to the North West of you.

children.name: Spot true bearing on NW Target
children.description: Select a sonar track that represents the True bearing for the target to the North West of you.

children.name: Select True bearing on SE track
children.description: Select the True bearing for the SE track

missions.name: Using ownship manoeuvres to determine ambiguous bearing
missions.description: Using ownship manoeuvres to determine bearing ambiguity
missions.situation: Your sonar is still showing ambiguous contacts.  You now need to start practicing against dived targets - where visual sightings aren't available

children.name: Select ownship
children.description: Start off by selecting the ownship track in the sonar

children.name: Spot Merchant track
children.description: Select any sonar track that represents the merchant to the North of you

children.name: Identify target track
children.description: Select any sonar track that represents the dived target

children.name: Spot true bearing
children.description: Select the true bearing to the dived target

children.name: Spot ambiguous bearing
children.description: Select the ambiguous bearing to the dived target

missions.name: Understanding noise levels
missions.description: Observing how changing Signal to Noise Ratios are shown in the sonar display
missions.situation: The simulated tracks you're encountering here will now start making speed changes

children.name: Spot Merchant truth track
children.description: Start off by selecting the truth track for the Merchant

children.name: Spot Merchant side lobe
children.description: Select a side-lobe on the Merchant's truth track.

children.name: Spot quieter Merchant main track
children.description: Select the main trace for the Merchant's truth track, after the side-lobes are lost

children.name: Spot ambiguous side-lobe on Merchant
children.description: Select a side lobe on the merchant's ambiguous track as it gets closer

children.name: Select Ownship track
children.description: Select the ownship track, once the merchant disappears in the bow null

children.name: Select disappearing Merchant
children.description: Select any trace on the merchant track once its side lobes have been lost

missions.name: Unsteady Array
missions.description: The effects of the array being unsteady
missions.situation: Ok, you're ready for a real puzzler. We're going to switch off the array heading sensors, so you will lose contact during and after each Ownship turn.  There's a dived target in the scenario, and we want you to track it.

children.name: Select dived target track [Leg 1]
children.description: Start off by selecting the truth track for the submarine to the West of you

children.name: Select dived target track [Leg 2]
children.description: Select the dived truth track after the end of the next turn

children.name: Select dived target track [Leg 3]
children.description: Select the dived truth track after the end of the next turn

children.name: Select dived target track [Leg 4]
children.description: Select the dived truth track after the end of the next turn

name: Ship Control
description: Authority to control vessel course and speed during transit to deployment area

missions.name: Learning ship control, the hard way
missions.description: Now that you have provisional ship control authority, you're going to be tested with a challenging transit.
missions.situation: We're transiting to load some special weapons, but we've got limited time and a flotilla of fishing vessels have just arrived.  Come alongside the static support vessel to the East of you without getting within 4000m of any trawlers.  Oh, and please don't exit your allocated water (the blue rectangle)

children.name: Avoid fishing vessels
children.description: Stay outside 3km of fishing vessels

children.name: Remain in allocated water
children.description: Stay within operating area

children.name: R/V with support barge
children.description: RAS next to Tactical Support Barge (Northerly course, less than 1km away, at less than 3 kts)

missions.name: Handling ownship noise levels
missions.description: Track a quiet but relatively fast moving friendly dived target.
missions.situation: A friendly SSN is transiting through our waters. We're going to experiment with tracking him.

children.name: Stay near dived target
children.description: Stay within 5km of dived target

missions.name: Determine target course at CPA
missions.description: How to use the bearing to target at CPA to approximate his course
missions.situation: We have to covertly indicate the target course to a third-party MPA, by passing a marker buoy at the same course as the target vessel

children.name: Covertly convey target course
children.description: Travel within 1km of marker, matching target course to within 20 degs

missions.name: Handling bow null
missions.description: Effective localisation, despite bow null
missions.situation: Your vessel obscures targets dead ahead of you, resulting in a bow null.  But, with the correct techniques you can still perform continuous tracking on a sonar contact.  In a benign environment you are going to track two types of vessel.

children.name: Gain sonar contact with Fishing Vessel
children.description: Gain contact on the fishing vessel East of you within 35 minutes

children.name: Maintain contact on surface target
children.description: Maintain contact on the fishing vessel for 45 minutes

children.name: Gain contact with dived submarine
children.description: There is a dived submarine near the North West marker.  Gain it on sonar within 50 minutes

children.name: Maintain contact on dived submarine
children.description: Maintain contact on the dived submarine for 45 minutes

name: Advance to contact
description: Engage with potential adversaries in a relatively benign region adjacent to theatre of operations

missions.name: Initial Ranging
missions.description: An introduction to passive ranging
missions.situation: To qualify to conduct TMA against a dived target, you first need to practice on a surface target - both to valid yourself and the TMA computer

children.name: Gain contact
children.description: Travel West to gain contact on the Platfom Support Vessel working in that area

children.name: Conduct 3 ranging times
children.description: Perform 3 ranging manoeuvres on surface target

missions.name: Successive ranging
missions.description: Maintain a target solution using a series of ranging manoeuvres

children.name: Gain contact
children.description: Gain contact on the training target

children.name: Range 2 times
children.description: Perform 2 accurate ranging manoeuvres

missions.name: Subtle turns
missions.description: Conducting ranging using small manoeuvres

children.name: Gain contact
children.description: Gain contact on the training target

children.name: Maintain contact
children.description: Maintain contact on the training target for one hour

missions.name: Lay in wait
missions.description: Use passive tracking to predict target route

children.name: Gain contact
children.description: Gain contact on the training target

children.name: Maintain contact
children.description: Maintain contact on the training target for one hour

name: Task Group Operations
description: Support High Value Units in complex environment

missions.name: Familiarise with area of operations
missions.description: Recognising a range of targets in the area
missions.situation: Before the HVU reaches our area of operations, we have to learn more about what's out there.  We've heard talk that an enemy submarine is shadowing merchant shipping. We don't have sufficient ROE to use weapons, but try to intimidate it with a close pass.

children.name: Gain contact
children.description: Gain contact on the target submarine

children.name: Deter submarine
children.description: Deter target submarine by passing within 1km

missions.name: Influence evasive SM
missions.description: Take control of the Ops Area by handing on an evasive SM to Airborne assets
missions.situation: Now that the dived SM knows who is boss, we're going to push him into an area of dense MPA coverage, so that we're free to transit to escort the incoming HVU.  Intel on his SOPs is that each time he detects us he will head out on the opposite bearing for around 15 minutes.

children.name: Gain contact on SM
children.description: Gain contact with the dived submarine, he's roughly to your North West

children.name: Force SM to MPA Coverage
children.description: Force target into MPA coverage zone

name: Developed Operations
description: Complex tasking, occasionally against advanced targets

missions.name: Advanced Ambiguity
missions.description: More advanced ambiguous bearings

children.name: Gain contact
children.description: Gain contact on the quiet training target within 15 minutes

children.name: Maintain contact
children.description: Maintain contact with the quiet training target for one hour

missions.description: Learn to drive, on the tracked range

children.description: Get started with missions

children.name: Conduct Noise Checks
children.description: Travel to rendez-vous point A for noise checks

children.name: Get Towed Array Fitted
children.description: Travel to Sonar Fitting barge

children.name: Array Handling Experience
children.description: Get used to towed array

children.name: Secret Quest
children.description: Get within 200 of Target vessel

children.description: Maintain contact on the training target for one hour

children.name: Gain contact
children.description: Gain contact on the target submarine
